<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/robinhood-explains-reasons-halting-trading-meme-stocks-last-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Robinhood Tries to Make People Hate It Less
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Robinhood illustration " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTI3L3JvYmluaG9vZF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Robinhood and other online brokerages restricted buying on certain highly volatile stocks including GameStop and AMC last Thursday, the internet <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/28/robinhood-curbs-trading-meme-stocks-causes-uproar?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went ballistic</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lots of folks immediately assumed the company curbed trading to "protect'' naive retail investors from hurting themselves. And more nefarious rumors spread that panicked hedge fund managers secretly worked out a deal with Robinhood leadership to halt trading on GameStop. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood's vague statement Thursday morning and a CNBC interview with CEO Vlad Tenev that evening did nothing to douse the fire.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what really happened? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the weekend, Robinhood tried to <a href="https://blog.robinhood.com/news/2021/1/29/what-happened-this-week?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explain</a>: Basically, the company was concerned that it wouldn't have enough money to fulfill its IOUs. Without getting into too much detail (you can do that <a href="https://twitter.com/compound248/status/1355274739351248898?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a> if you want), a trade you make on Robinhood isn't actually <em>settled </em>until two days after you press "buy" or "sell." In the interim, Robinhood and other brokerages provide collateral to a third-party, the Depository Trust and Clearing Corporation (DTCC), to cover your transaction.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, because of the tremendous volatility around certain stocks and the volume of trading, Robinhood needed to deposit <em>10x</em> as much money as it typically does—money Robinhood wasn't sure it had. So it shut down buy orders on those stocks, tapped hundreds of millions in credit, and raised $1 billion overnight. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What happened to Robinhood happened to other brokerages, too. The CEO of Webull, a Chinese-owned trading platform that also restricted trading on "meme" stocks, </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/zGuz/status/1354854476801302528?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span>, "It wasn't our choice...this has to do with settlement mechanics in the market." </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>What's that saying about there's no such thing as bad publicity? Well, it definitely applies here. Robinhood was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/30/business/robinhood-wall-street-gamestop.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">downloaded</a> more than 177k times last Thursday, twice its download rate the previous week. That day, it also recorded more daily active users than all of its competitors combined. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMODITIES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/silver-prices-pop-amid-frenzied-interest-retail-traders?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tired: GameStop<br>Wired: Silver
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amateur investors on Reddit have a new target for speculative trading: a white, lustrous metal known for its electrical conductivity called silver. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prices shot up around 7% when trading opened yesterday evening to their highest level in five months. Ahead of the trading window this weekend, demand for silver bars and coins was <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-31/silver-retail-sites-grind-to-halt-as-reddit-horde-moves-to-coins?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">so enormous</a> that several websites including Apmex, which Bloomberg labels "the Walmart of precious metals products in North America," were unable to process transactions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The storm had been brewing for a few days. Last week, as we were all focused on stocks like GameStop, users on r/WallStreetBets were also rallying traders to buy the precious metal, sending March silver futures up more than 5% for the week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why silver? </strong>Bloomberg has <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-29/reddit-mob-bids-up-silver-other-commodities-are-harder-to-crack?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some insight</a>: "Market manipulation has been the rallying cry of conspiracy theorists in precious metals circles for decades, if not centuries. With their constant railing against banks and big government colluding to mask inflation, it was only a matter of time before they and retail investors raging against the financial machine joined forces."</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/researchers-begin-investigation-covid19-origins?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
An Origin Story More Mysterious Than Superman's
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Thea Fischer, Marion Koopmans, Peter Daszak and other members of the World Health Organization (WHO) team investigating the origins of the Covid-19 pandemic, leave the Hilton Wuhan Optics Valley Hotel where the team is currently based post-quarantine in Wuhan." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTAyL2NoaW5hLWhlYWx0aC12aXJ1cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Hector Retamal via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Late last week, a team of World Health Organization researchers wrapped up their quarantine after arriving in Wuhan, China, and <a href="https://apnews.com/article/how-experts-hunt-covid-19-origins-china-1b35437b13b6c3abf86150a17116772b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">began</a> a formal investigation into the coronavirus's origins.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Their mission: </strong>to understand where the virus started (China’s CDC thinks Wuhan was the spreader, not the birthplace) and how it jumped to humans. To do so, they'll take field visits to the city's hospitals, labs, and the seafood market where the outbreak started. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The WHO has stressed that the purpose of this investigation is to learn more about the virus and help prevent future outbreaks. Still, questions about China's attempts to hide information about the virus linger.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At the Sundance Film Festival, filmmaker Nanfu Wang </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/film/2021/jan/29/in-the-same-breath-review-nanfu-wangs-shattering-covid-19-documentary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">premiered</a></span><span> </span><span><em>In the Same Breath</em></span><span>, a documentary exploring the propaganda, coverups, and disinformation spread by Chinese </span><span><em>and </em></span><span>American governments during the pandemic. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>we'll have two more installments from George R.R. Martin before researchers have answers. It took over a decade to figure out where SARS started, and Ebola's origins are still a mystery. </p>

ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/exxon-chevron-reportedly-discussed-merger?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Exxon Mobil, Chevron Explore the Buddy System
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Harry Styles and Olivia Wilde weren't the only unexpected romance of Covid-19. When pandemic shutdowns clobbered the fossil fuel sector last year, the US' largest oil producers reportedly <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/exxon-chevron-ceos-discussed-merger-11612126203?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">discussed merging</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Chexron Mobil never made it down the aisle, WSJ sources say the deal, which would create a $350 billion oil behemoth, could happen later. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Exxon and Chevron <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/31/chevron-and-exxon-discussed-merger-last-year-after-covid-pandemic-devastated-oil-prices-reports-say.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are descendants</a> of John D. Rockefeller's Standard Oil, which regulators dismantled in 1911. Their tie-up would be the biggest oil merger since Exxon + Mobil in 1999 and Chevron + Texaco in 2001.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But now, as the industry faces financial hurricanes, consolidation could speed up. Exxon was the country's most valuable public company just seven years ago, but it was kicked off the Dow last year and is expected to report its first full-year loss in modern history tomorrow. Chevron lost $5.5 billion last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>While some competitors are investing in renewables, Chevron and Exxon believe "the world will need vast amounts of fossil fuels for decades to come, and that they can capitalize on current underinvestment in oil production," the WSJ writes. Doing it together could save billions...assuming they'd get the Biden administration’s signoff. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shoveling: </strong>A snowstorm is currently pummeling the Northeast, and it’s likely to snarl travel into Tuesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>We're on the downslope of Q4 earnings season, but there are plenty of big names still to come this week, including Alphabet, Amazon, Exxon Mobil, Pfizer, and Snap. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economy:</strong> The first jobs report of Biden's presidency will arrive Friday, and it could influence the conversation about the various stimulus proposals floating around Washington.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Black History Month starts today: </strong>Throughout February, organizations and businesses across the US will honor the central role Black Americans have played in the country's history. We're excited for NPR's special Black History Month <a href="https://www.npr.org/about-npr/961997595/celebrating-black-history-month-at-the-tiny-desk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tiny Desk series</a>,<em> </em>which features 13 home concerts by Black artists.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Groundhog Day is tomorrow. Hoping Punxsutawney Phil will predict an early end to the pandemic.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Golden Globe nominations are announced on Wednesday.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Super Bowl is Sunday.</span></li>
</ul>

aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid-19: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere are fewer than 100,000 Americans \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/31/health/us-coronavirus-sunday/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehospitalized\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with Covid for the first time in nearly two months. And starting this week, the CDC is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/30/962390180/cdc-issues-sweeping-new-mask-mandate-for-u-s-travelers-extends-eviction-moratori?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequiring\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e mask-wearing on all public transportation, including planes, subways, taxis/rideshares, and buses.   \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGovernment: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e10 Senate Republicans announced a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/31/962554923/10-senate-republicans-plan-to-detail-slimmed-down-covid-19-counteroffer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecounterproposal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to President Biden's $1.9 trillion stimulus package, this one costing about $600 billion. We'll hear the details today. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRADING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/robinhood-explains-reasons-halting-trading-meme-stocks-last-week?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nRobinhood Tries to Make People Hate It Less\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Robinhood illustration \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTI3L3JvYmluaG9vZF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Robinhood and other online brokerages restricted buying on certain highly volatile stocks including GameStop and AMC last Thursday, the internet \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/28/robinhood-curbs-trading-meme-stocks-causes-uproar?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent ballistic\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLots of folks immediately assumed the company curbed trading to \"protect'' naive retail investors from hurting themselves. And more nefarious rumors spread that panicked hedge fund managers secretly worked out a deal with Robinhood leadership to halt trading on GameStop. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood's vague statement Thursday morning and a CNBC interview with CEO Vlad Tenev that evening did nothing to douse the fire.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what really happened? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the weekend, Robinhood tried to \u003ca href=\"https://blog.robinhood.com/news/2021/1/29/what-happened-this-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplain\u003c/a\u003e: Basically, the company was concerned that it wouldn't have enough money to fulfill its IOUs. Without getting into too much detail (you can do that \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/compound248/status/1355274739351248898?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e if you want), a trade you make on Robinhood isn't actually \u003cem\u003esettled \u003c/em\u003euntil two days after you press \"buy\" or \"sell.\" In the interim, Robinhood and other brokerages provide collateral to a third-party, the Depository Trust and Clearing Corporation (DTCC), to cover your transaction.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, because of the tremendous volatility around certain stocks and the volume of trading, Robinhood needed to deposit \u003cem\u003e10x\u003c/em\u003e as much money as it typically does—money Robinhood wasn't sure it had. So it shut down buy orders on those stocks, tapped hundreds of millions in credit, and raised $1 billion overnight. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhat happened to Robinhood happened to other brokerages, too. The CEO of Webull, a Chinese-owned trading platform that also restricted trading on \"meme\" stocks, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/zGuz/status/1354854476801302528?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \"It wasn't our choice...this has to do with settlement mechanics in the market.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhat's that saying about there's no such thing as bad publicity? Well, it definitely applies here. Robinhood was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/30/business/robinhood-wall-street-gamestop.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edownloaded\u003c/a\u003e more than 177k times last Thursday, twice its download rate the previous week. That day, it also recorded more daily active users than all of its competitors combined. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Silver\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmateur investors on Reddit have a new target for speculative trading: a white, lustrous metal known for its electrical conductivity called silver. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrices shot up around 7% when trading opened yesterday evening to their highest level in five months. Ahead of the trading window this weekend, demand for silver bars and coins was \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-31/silver-retail-sites-grind-to-halt-as-reddit-horde-moves-to-coins?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eso enormous\u003c/a\u003e that several websites including Apmex, which Bloomberg labels \"the Walmart of precious metals products in North America,\" were unable to process transactions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe storm had been brewing for a few days. Last week, as we were all focused on stocks like GameStop, users on r/WallStreetBets were also rallying traders to buy the precious metal, sending March silver futures up more than 5% for the week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy silver? \u003c/strong\u003eBloomberg has \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-29/reddit-mob-bids-up-silver-other-commodities-are-harder-to-crack?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome insight\u003c/a\u003e: \"Market manipulation has been the rallying cry of conspiracy theorists in precious metals circles for decades, if not centuries. With their constant railing against banks and big government colluding to mask inflation, it was only a matter of time before they and retail investors raging against the financial machine joined forces.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLate last week, a team of World Health Organization researchers wrapped up their quarantine after arriving in Wuhan, China, and \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/how-experts-hunt-covid-19-origins-china-1b35437b13b6c3abf86150a17116772b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegan\u003c/a\u003e a formal investigation into the coronavirus's origins.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTheir mission: \u003c/strong\u003eto understand where the virus started (China’s CDC thinks Wuhan was the spreader, not the birthplace) and how it jumped to humans. To do so, they'll take field visits to the city's hospitals, labs, and the seafood market where the outbreak started. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe WHO has stressed that the purpose of this investigation is to learn more about the virus and help prevent future outbreaks. Still, questions about China's attempts to hide information about the virus linger.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt the Sundance Film Festival, filmmaker Nanfu Wang \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/film/2021/jan/29/in-the-same-breath-review-nanfu-wangs-shattering-covid-19-documentary?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epremiered\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn the Same Breath\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a documentary exploring the propaganda, coverups, and disinformation spread by Chinese \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eand \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmerican governments during the pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewe'll have two more installments from George R.R. Martin before researchers have answers. When pandemic shutdowns clobbered the fossil fuel sector last year, the US' largest oil producers reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/exxon-chevron-ceos-discussed-merger-11612126203?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediscussed merging\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Chexron Mobil never made it down the aisle, WSJ sources say the deal, which would create a $350 billion oil behemoth, could happen later. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eExxon and Chevron \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/31/chevron-and-exxon-discussed-merger-last-year-after-covid-pandemic-devastated-oil-prices-reports-say.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare descendants\u003c/a\u003e of John D. Rockefeller's Standard Oil, which regulators dismantled in 1911. Their tie-up would be the biggest oil merger since Exxon + Mobil in 1999 and Chevron + Texaco in 2001.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut now, as the industry faces financial hurricanes, consolidation could speed up. Exxon was the country's most valuable public company just seven years ago, but it was kicked off the Dow last year and is expected to report its first full-year loss in modern history tomorrow. Chevron lost $5.5 billion last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile some competitors are investing in renewables, Chevron and Exxon believe \"the world will need vast amounts of fossil fuels for decades to come, and that they can capitalize on current underinvestment in oil production,\" the WSJ writes. Doing it together could save billions...assuming they'd get the Biden administration’s signoff. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F01%2F31%2Fexxon-chevron-reportedly-discussed-merger\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
